prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
The main goal of this project is to robustly detect clumpy HCO+ (4-3) emission in the central regions of a sample of 5 local star-forming luminous infrared galaxies. In addition, we will also observe the CO (3-2) line and the dust continuum at ~ 860um. The required spectral resolution is 20 km/s, enough to achieve the goals of this proposal.
The CO (3-2) and HCO+ (4-3) line fluxes are estimated based on the integrated emission of the CO (4-3) line observed by Herschel/SPIRE, and after assuming a factor of 0.5 for the CO (3-2) / CO (4-3) ratio (Carilli et al. 2013) and a factor of 0.05 for the HCO+ (4-3) / CO (4-3) ratio (Wilson et al. 2008). The HCO+ (43) line is the most faint of the features we want to observe and therefore it is the one on which the requested sensitivities are based. We assume that approximately 50% of the line fluxes are contained within the central ~1". We have assumed a width for the lines of 300 km/s. When calculating the sensitivities, we require to detect the HCO+ (4-3) line at a S/N = 20. The CO (3-2) and the continuum emission will be detected at much larger S/N (> 100). The requested sensitivity is 0.5mJy.

Each spectral window has a bandwidth of 1875 MHz and a spectral resolution averaged to ~7.8 MHz (~7 km/s) to minimize the data rate, since the final requested resolution is 25 km/s, enough to resolve the gas motion in the expected rotating disks and clumps.

We request Band 7 with ALMA in extended array configuration at an angular resolution of 0.08", which will allow us to resolve structures on scales of ~25 pc at the distance to our galaxies. A single pointing will be enough to measure the line flux in the desired nuclear area (~500 kpc). The recoverable angular scale is much larger than the expected sizes of the line-emitting clumps and therefore no ACA observations are needed.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The goal of this project is to pinpoint the location and measure the compactness of the dense molecular gas in the central kpc of five nearby, starburst-dominated luminous infrared (IR) galaxies (LIRGs) selected to show significantly low [CII] 158m line to far-IR (FIR) continuum ratios, < 10^-3. To this end, we request Band 7 ALMA observations for these galaxies in the HCO+ (J=4-3) and CO (J=3-2) molecular gas lines as well as of the 860um dust continuum emission. Being able to access the distribution of the dense and diffuse molecular gas as well as the cold dust in the inter-stellar medium (ISM) on scales of ~ 40 pc will allow us to test the scenario in which LIRGs with low [CII]/FIR ratios and high kpc-scale IR-luminosity surface densities (IR) also show more compact star-forming regions. This will provide an important link between the large-scale variations of the [CII]/FIR ratio observed in local LIRGs and the sub-kpc spatial configuration of their dense molecular gas content, key for interpreting observations of high-z star-forming galaxies detected in [CII] with ALMA.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:keyword: Luminous and Ultra-Luminous Infra-Red Galaxies (LIRG & ULIRG)

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Nucleo de Astronomia, Universidad Diego Portales
